structure.heading: Rated for operation at frequencies above 2.7 GHz and all of the following:
structure.label: 3A001.b.4.f – Rated for operation at frequencies above 2.7 GHz and all of the following:

children.heading: A peak saturated power output (in watts), Psat, greater than 400 divided by the maximum operating frequency (in GHz) squared [Psat > 400 W*GHz 2/fGHz 2];

children.heading: A “fractional bandwidth” of 5% or greater; and
children.label: 3A001.b.4.f.2 – A “fractional bandwidth” of 5% or greater; and

content.html: b.4.f.2. A “fractional bandwidth” of 5% or greater; and
content.text: b.4.f.2. A “fractional bandwidth” of 5% or greater; and

children.heading: Any two sides perpendicular to one another with either length d (in cm) equal to or less than 15 divided by the lowest operating frequency in GHz [d ≤ 15 cm*GHz/fGHz];
children.label: 3A001.b.4.f.3 – Any two sides perpendicular to one another with either length d (in cm) equal to or less than 15 divided by the lowest operating frequency in GHz [d ≤ 15 cm*GHz/fGHz];

content.html: b.4.f.3. Any two sides perpendicular to one another with either length d (in cm) equal to or less than 15 divided by the lowest operating frequency in GHz [d ≤ 15 cm*GHz/fGHz];
content.text: b.4.f.3. Any two sides perpendicular to one another with either length d (in cm) equal to or less than 15 divided by the lowest operating frequency in GHz [d ≤ 15 cm*GHz/fGHz];

content.html:
Technical Note:

2.7 GHz should be used as the lowest operating frequency (fGHz) in the formula in 3A001.b.4.f.3., for amplifiers that have a rated operation range extending downward to 2.7 GHz and below [d ≤ 15 cm*GHz/2.7 GHz].
content.text: Technical Note: 2.7 GHz should be used as the lowest operating frequency (fGHz) in the formula in 3A001.b.4.f.3., for amplifiers that have a rated operation range extending downward to 2.7 GHz and below [d ≤ 15 cm*GHz/2.7 GHz].
N.B.: MMIC power amplifiers should be evaluated against the criteria in 3A001.b.2.
